Helper functions for managing events -- not part of the public interface. Props to Dean Edwards' addEvent library for many of the ideas.

jQuery.Event is based on DOM3 Events as specified by the ECMAScript Language Binding http://www.w3.org/TR/2003/WD-DOM-Level-3-Events-20030331/ecma-script-binding.html

jQuery.Event.prototype = { isDefaultPrevented: returnFalse, isPropagationStopped: returnFalse, isImmediatePropagationStopped: returnFalse, preventDefault: function() { var e = this.originalEvent; this.isDefaultPrevented = returnTrue; if ( e && e.preventDefault ) { e.preventDefault(); } }, stopPropagation: function() { var e = this.originalEvent; this.isPropagationStopped = returnTrue; if ( e && e.stopPropagation ) { e.stopPropagation(); } }, stopImmediatePropagation: function() { var e = this.originalEvent; this.isImmediatePropagationStopped = returnTrue; if ( e && e.stopImmediatePropagation ) { e.stopImmediatePropagation(); } this.stopPropagation(); } };
